title: DIANNmv
text: package can used process analyze mass spec data generated DIANN. mainly uses DEP package hood, can use DEP functions created summarizedExperiment object (check DEP vignette). Also included visualization function prefer default DEP options.

title: DIANNmv
text: sample names report.pg_matrix report.pr_matrix structured like , prepare_diann_data() function can tidy sample names create experimentalDesign , can used downstream. Alternatively, can done manually.
code: tidy_data <- prepare_diann_data(report.pg_matrix, report.pr_matrix) #> Warning in max(which(!selection == T)): no non-missing arguments to max; #> returning -Inf #> Warning in colnames(pr_matrix)[start_index_pr:ncol(pr_matrix)] <- cn: number of #> items to replace is not a multiple of replacement length #>                 label condition replicate #> neg_ctrl_3 neg_ctrl_3  neg_ctrl         3 #> motif1_1     motif1_1    motif1         1 #> motif1_2     motif1_2    motif1         2 #> motif1_3     motif1_3    motif1         3 #> motif2_1     motif2_1    motif2         1 #> motif2_2     motif2_2    motif2         2 #> motif2_3     motif2_3    motif2         3 pg_matrix <- tidy_data$pg_matrix pr_matrix <- tidy_data$pr_matrix

title: DIANNmv
text: report.pg_matrix, report.pr_matrix expDesign combined summarizedExperiment (se) object used downstream analysis plotting. create se object, can run prepare_se() function report.pg_matrix file associated experimental design. can specify type imputation done. default ‘mixed’, uses missing---random (MNAR) missing--random (MAR) imputation. MNAR/MAR specific imputation, ‘knn’ ‘MinProb’ advised, respectively. ‘none’ entered impute parameter, imputation done. Additionally, can filter missing values (missing_thr), potential contaminants removed default. (Source: contaminants.txt file maxquant).  provide report.pr_matrix alongside report.pg_matrix, peptide information automatically added can filter minimal number razor/unique peptides (min_pep, default = 1). Make sure sample column names identical match label column experimental design.  summarizedExperiment object stores lot information. can see output , consists 5584 proteinGroups (rows) 9 samples (columns). Furthermore, experimental design stored ‘colData’, extra information stored ‘rowData’. log2 transformed intensities form main assay. Furthermore, report.pr_matrix file provided, second assay added. detailed description structure summarizedExperiments, check documentation. short, access different parts data:
code: se <- prepare_se(report.pg_matrix, expDesign) # without peptide information #> Imputing along margin 2 (samples/columns). #> [1] 0.3058978 #> Imputing along margin 1 (features/rows). #> Warning in knnimp(x, k, maxmiss = rowmax, maxp = maxp): 36 rows with more than 50 % entries missing; #>  mean imputation used for these rows #> Cluster size 5511 broken into 3577 1934  #> Cluster size 3577 broken into 2319 1258  #> Cluster size 2319 broken into 3 2316  #> Done cluster 3  #> Cluster size 2316 broken into 1144 1172  #> Done cluster 1144  #> Done cluster 1172  #> Done cluster 2316  #> Done cluster 2319  #> Done cluster 1258  #> Done cluster 3577  #> Cluster size 1934 broken into 1298 636  #> Done cluster 1298  #> Done cluster 636  #> Done cluster 1934 se #> class: SummarizedExperiment  #> dim: 5547 9  #> metadata(0): #> assays(2): '' imputation_mask #> rownames(5547): A2M A2ML1 ... ZYX ZZZ3 #> rowData names(7): Protein.Group Protein.Names ... name ID #> colnames(9): neg_ctrl_1 neg_ctrl_2 ... motif2_2 motif2_3 #> colData names(4): label ID condition replicate # Add peptide information and remove all proteinGroups with <2 total  # razor/unique peptides se <- prepare_se(report.pg_matrix, expDesign, report.pr_matrix, min_pep = 2) #> Imputing along margin 2 (samples/columns). #> [1] 0.2967394 #> Imputing along margin 1 (features/rows). #> Warning in knnimp(x, k, maxmiss = rowmax, maxp = maxp): 19 rows with more than 50 % entries missing; #>  mean imputation used for these rows #> Cluster size 5200 broken into 2219 2981  #> Cluster size 2219 broken into 1622 597  #> Cluster size 1622 broken into 940 682  #> Done cluster 940  #> Done cluster 682  #> Done cluster 1622  #> Done cluster 597  #> Done cluster 2219  #> Cluster size 2981 broken into 2256 725  #> Cluster size 2256 broken into 1138 1118  #> Done cluster 1138  #> Done cluster 1118  #> Done cluster 2256  #> Done cluster 725  #> Done cluster 2981 se #> class: SummarizedExperiment  #> dim: 5219 9  #> metadata(1): pr_matrix #> assays(3): '' peptide_info imputation_mask #> rownames(5219): A2M A2ML1 ... what: Note on integration with the DEP package
title: DIANNmv
text: experimental design sample labels follow convention , created summararizedExperiment object work seamlessly DEP. However, deviate structure (e.g.  use different condition names sample names), might run problems. want use DEP functions anyways, can run use_dep() make work.
code: se_dep <- use_dep(se)

title: DIANNmv
text: report.pr_matrix report.pg_matrix files can used add peptide number information, iBAQ values, median peptide intensities, alternative iBAQ.

title: DIANNmv
text: information automatically added se object running prepare_se() providing report.pr_matrix file (see ). can also manually add report.pg_matrix() file following code. get number razor/unique peptides per proteinGroup per sample total number razor/unique peptides samples, add report.pg_matrix file: adds new columns suffix ‘npep’ report.pg_matrix number identified peptides per sample, ‘n_total’ total number identified razor/unique peptides per proteinGroup.
code: peptides <- get_nPep_prMatrix(report.pr_matrix) pg_matrix <- add_peptide_numbers(report.pg_matrix, peptides) colnames(pg_matrix) #>  [1] "Protein.Group"             "Protein.Names"             #>  [3] "Genes"                     "First.Protein.Description" #>  [5] "neg_ctrl_1"                "neg_ctrl_2"                #>  [7] "neg_ctrl_3"                "motif1_1"                  #>  [9] "motif1_2"                  "motif1_3"                  #> [11] "motif2_1"                  "motif2_2"                  #> [13] "motif2_3"                  "neg_ctrl_1_npep"           #> [15] "neg_ctrl_2_npep"           "neg_ctrl_3_npep"           #> [17] "motif1_1_npep"             "motif1_2_npep"             #> [19] "motif1_3_npep"             "motif2_1_npep"             #> [21] "motif2_2_npep"             "motif2_3_npep"             #> [23] "n_total"

title: DIANNmv
text: iBAQ values can added pg_matrix file well. , need number theoretically observable peptides, non-normalized intensities. number iBAQ peptides reviewed human mouse uniprot entries included package can accessed : want use , can create similar object fasta file: Non-normalized intensities can calculated sum individual peptide intensites report.pr_matrix file: combined add_iBAQ() function, addes columns iBAQ values column number iBAQ peptides report.pg_matrix. use included iBAQ peptides, specify organism. use custom file, specify ‘ibaq_stats’ parameter. iBAQ values automatically added summarizedExperiment object running prepare_se() function. addition, number iBAQ peptides added rowData.
code: ibaq_peptides <- DIANNmv::ibaq_peptides hs <- ibaq_peptides$hs #Human entries mm <- ibaq_peptides$mm # Mouse entries no_ibaq_peptides <- get_ibaq_peptides('path/to/fasta.fasta') intensities <- get_intensities_prMatrix(report.pr_matrix) pg <- add_iBAQ(report.pg_matrix, report.pr_matrix, organism = 'hs') # Standard colnames(pg) #>  [1] "Protein.Group"             "Protein.Names"             #>  [3] "Genes"                     "First.Protein.Description" #>  [5] "neg_ctrl_1"                "neg_ctrl_2"                #>  [7] "neg_ctrl_3"                "motif1_1"                  #>  [9] "motif1_2"                  "motif1_3"                  #> [11] "motif2_1"                  "motif2_2"                  #> [13] "motif2_3"                  "neg_ctrl_1_iBAQ"           #> [15] "neg_ctrl_2_iBAQ"           "neg_ctrl_3_iBAQ"           #> [17] "motif1_1_iBAQ"             "motif1_2_iBAQ"             #> [19] "motif1_3_iBAQ"             "motif2_1_iBAQ"             #> [21] "motif2_2_iBAQ"             "motif2_3_iBAQ"             #> [23] "ibaq_peptides" pg <- add_iBAQ(report.pg_matrix, report.pr_matrix, organism = 'hs') se <- prepare_se(pg, expDesign, report.pr_matrix) #> Imputing along margin 2 (samples/columns). #> [1] 0.3050842 #> Imputing along margin 1 (features/rows). #> Warning in knnimp(x, k, maxmiss = rowmax, maxp = maxp): 33 rows with more than 50 % entries missing; title: DIANNmv
text: perform differential protein expression analysis, run get_DEPresults() function. three main types: ‘manual’ (1 vs 1), ‘control’ (vs 1), ‘’ (vs ). ‘manual’, can also specify contrasts want test providing character vector ‘tests’ parameter.addition, can choose p.adj cutoff log2 fold change cutoffs significant, method FDR correction. DEP default ‘fdrtool’, given weird results past. Therefore, default ‘BH’ (Benjamini-Hochberg), also default limma uses (DEP uses background). get_DEPresults returns data frame statistics specified tests, can used visualization afterwards.
code: # To test a 1 vs 1 comparison res_man <- get_DEPresults(se, condition1 = 'motif1', condition2 = 'neg_ctrl',                       type = 'manual') #> Tested contrasts: motif1_vs_neg_ctrl  # To test multiple 1 vs 1 comparisons res_man2 <- get_DEPresults(se,                            tests = c('motif1_vs_neg_ctrl', 'motif1_vs_motif2'),                            type = 'manual') #> Tested contrasts: motif1_vs_neg_ctrl, motif1_vs_motif2  # To test all conditions vs 1 reference condition res_ref <- get_DEPresults(se, ref_condition = 'neg_ctrl', type = 'control') #> Tested contrasts: motif1_vs_neg_ctrl, motif2_vs_neg_ctrl  # To test all vs all res <- get_DEPresults(se, type = 'all') #> Tested contrasts: neg_ctrl_vs_motif1, neg_ctrl_vs_motif2, motif1_vs_motif2

title: DIANNmv
text: plotVolcano() function returns volcano plots specified significance cutoffs. 1 comparison present results data frame, list volcano plots returned can accessed ‘$’ operator. default, proteins imputed values two conditions compared specified. Check help page plotVolcano() (?plotVolcano) see different options labeling specific points volcano.
code: plotVolcano(res_man) # Default volcano plot if one comparison is present. # labels all significant points (can be a bit much).   volcano_list <- plotVolcano(res_ref, label = '') # returns list of volcano plots                                                  # Don't label anything. volcano_list$motif1_vs_neg_ctrl # Select which plot you want to see. # Example of a very ugly volcano plot. plotVolcano(res_man, pval_cutoff = 0.001, fc_cutoff = 2,             up_color =  'blue', down_color = 'yellow', ns_color = 'green',             label = c('SMAD3', 'SMAD4'))

code: upset_plot <- plot_upset(res) upset_plot #> Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the ggupset package. #>   Please report the issue at <https://github.com/const-ae/ggupset/issues>. #> This warning is displayed once per session. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was #> generated. plot_DEP_barplot(res) # Include only two comparisons and change the order: plot_DEP_barplot(res, comparisons = c('neg_ctrl_vs_motif2',                                       'neg_ctrl_vs_motif1')) # Same as above, but axis labels are changed. plot_DEP_barplot(res, comparisons = c('neg_ctrl_vs_motif2',                                       'neg_ctrl_vs_motif1'),                  names = c('motif2', 'motif1'))

title: DIANNmv
text: GSEA can performed results get_DEPresults(). works results object contains one comparison. make lot sense GSEA DNA pull , used demonstration purposes nonetheless. addition results object, need gene sets want test. , need download msigdb superset gene sets, extract sets want. commonly, cancer hallmarks (h), curated gene sets (c2) gene ontology gene sets (c5) used. extract : perform GSEA, use results object gene sets choice:
code: db <- load_msigdb(organism = 'hs') # loads the super set #> see ?msigdb and browseVignettes('msigdb') for documentation #> downloading 1 resources #> retrieving 1 resource #> loading from cache #> require("GSEABase") #>  #> Warning in getMsigOrganism(gsc, idType): Assuming the organism to be human.  # retrieve the cancer hallmarks  geneset_hallmarks <- get_genesets(db, collection = 'h')   # retrieve the GO:biological process gene sets. # similarly molecular function (GOMF) and cellular compartment (GOCC) can be  # retrieved geneset_gobp <- get_genesets(db, collection = 'c5', subcollection = 'GOBP') res <- get_DEPresults(se, 'motif1', 'neg_ctrl') #> Tested contrasts: motif1_vs_neg_ctrl gsea <- perform_GSEA(res, geneset_gobp)

title: DIANNmv
text: several options visualize GSEA results. simplest bar plot, showing just Normalized Enrichment Scores (NES). default options shows significant results. specifying top_n parameter, can include n pathways lowest padj value. also remove prefix, shorten names pathways maximum 35 characters.   plot_gsea_dotplot() function, can include information pathways:  third way way visualize results GSEA volcano plot NES x-axis -log10(padj) y-axis. Like volcano plot DEP visualization, can specify label points.   ran multiple GSEAs different results objects (get_DEPresults()), can plot single bubble plot.  Finally, can plot enrichment plots individual pathways plot_gsea_enrichment_plot():
code: # Bar plot of 10 pathways with lowest padj values. barplot <- plot_gsea_barplot(gsea, top_n = 10, remove_prefix = T,                              max_name_length = 35) barplot #Bar plot of 10 pathways with lowest values and different colors for bars. barplot2 <- plot_gsea_barplot(gsea, pos_color = 'red3',                                neg_color = 'dodgerblue', top_n = 10,                                remove_prefix = T, max_name_length = 35)  barplot2 dotplot <- plot_gsea_dotplot(gsea, top_n = 10,                              remove_prefix = T, max_name_length = 35)  dotplot # Plot all significant points (can be chaotic) volcano <- plot_gsea_volcano(gsea)  volcano # plot 10 significant points with the lowest padj value on both sides of volcano. volcano <- plot_gsea_volcano(gsea, top_n = 10)                                 volcano res1 <- get_DEPresults(se, 'motif1', 'neg_ctrl') #> Tested contrasts: motif1_vs_neg_ctrl res2 <- get_DEPresults(se, 'motif2', 'neg_ctrl') #> Tested contrasts: motif2_vs_neg_ctrl  gsea1 <- perform_GSEA(res1, geneset_gobp) gsea2 <- perform_GSEA(res2, geneset_gobp)  bubble <- plot_gsea_bubbleplot(gsea1, gsea2,                                sample_names = c('motif1', 'motif2'), top_n = 10,                                 remove_prefix = T, max_name_length = 35)  bubble #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`). pathways <- c('HALLMARK_MYC_TARGETS_V1', 'HALLMARK_TGF_BETA_SIGNALING') enrichment_plots <- plot_gsea_enrichment_plot(geneset_hallmarks, pathways, res)  enrichment_plots$HALLMARK_MYC_TARGETS_V1

code: plotVolcano(   res,   pval_cutoff = 0.05,   fc_cutoff = 1,   label = "sig",   top_n = NULL,   up_color = "red3",   down_color = "dodgerblue",   ns_color = "grey70",   specify_imputed = T,   remove_overimputed = F )

title: create volcano plots for all comparisons present in the results file — plotVolcano
text: res data frame results get_DEPresults() pval_cutoff p.adj significance cutoff fc_cutoff log2 fold change significance cutoff label Specifies points label. default 'sig', labeling significant points. Entering value top_n limits labeling top_n - top_n -regulated proteins based p.adj. providing vector protein names, points labeled. top_n Specifies many significant points label. up_color Specifies color significantly -regulated proteins. down_color Specifies color significantly -regulated proteins. ns_color Specifies color non-significant proteins. specify_imputed Boolean specifying whether proteins imputed values need indicated open circles, versus closed circles complete cases. remove_overimputed Boolean value. set TRUE, proteins many imputed values 1-vs-1 comparisons removed. Requires 'missing_thr' set get_DEPresults.

title: create volcano plots for all comparisons present in the results file — plotVolcano
text: single ggplot object (1 comparison) list ggplot objects.

title: create volcano plots for all comparisons present in the results file — plotVolcano
code: library(ggplot2) library(ggrepel)  se <- prepare_se(report.pg_matrix, expDesign)  #> Imputing along margin 2 (samples/columns). #> [1] 0.3058978 #> Imputing along margin 1 (features/rows). #> Warning: 36 rows with more than 50 % entries missing; #>  mean imputation used for these rows #> Cluster size 5511 broken into 3577 1934  #> Cluster size 3577 broken into 2319 1258  #> Cluster size 2319 broken into 3 2316  #> Done cluster 3  #> Cluster size 2316 broken into 1144 1172  #> Done cluster 1144  #> Done cluster 1172  #> Done cluster 2316  #> Done cluster 2319  #> Done cluster 1258  #> Done cluster 3577  #> Cluster size 1934 broken into 1298 636  #> Done cluster 1298  #> Done cluster 636  #> Done cluster 1934  res <- get_DEPresults(se, type = 'all') #> Tested contrasts: neg_ctrl_vs_motif1, neg_ctrl_vs_motif2, motif1_vs_motif2 vol <- plotVolcano(res, top_n = 10) # Labels the top 10 upregulated and # top10 downregulated proteins based on fdr. vol <- plotVolcano(res, label = c('SMAD3', 'SMAD4')) # Only labels SMAD3/4 vol <- plotVolcano(res, up_color = 'green', down_color = 'yellow') # # Gives a very ugly volcano plot
